creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
medium: Hanging scroll, ink, color, and lacquer on paper (urushi-e)
text: Onagadori are roosters specially bred in Japan for their long tail feathers. Here, Shibata Zeshin depicted an extraordinary specimen whose feathers hang to the ground from the rooster's perch on a plum branch. Typical of Zeshin's style, the bird is rendered with superhuman precision, with each feather of its luxurious plumage carefully delineated in lustrous pigments.
title: Long-tailed Rooster
